```html Summary of Bill S-230

An Act to amend the Corrections and Conditional Release Act

Bill Number: S-230

Current Status: Providing Alternatives to Isolation and Ensuring Oversight and Remedies in the Correctional System Act (Tona’s Law)

Legislative Progress

Last Major Stage Completed: At consideration in committee in the Senate

Parliament Session: 44th Parliament, 1st session

Senate Readings:

  • First - Completed
  • Second - Completed
  • Third - Not Completed

House Readings:

  • First - Not Completed
  • Second - Not Completed
  • Third - Not Completed

Royal Assent: Not Completed

Sponsor

Senator: Kim Pate

Bill Type

Type: Senate Public Bill

Bill Content Summary

This enactment amends the Corrections and Conditional Release Act to, among other things:

  • Transfer for Mental Health: Require that if a person who is sentenced, transferred, or committed to a penitentiary has disabling mental health issues, they will be transferred to a hospital.
  • Isolation Orders: Ensure that a person may only be confined in a structured intervention unit for longer than 48 hours on an order of a superior court.
  • Correctional Provisions: Allow for the provision of additional corrections measures aimed at those with specific needs.

Contact

If you have any questions or comments regarding the accessibility of this publication, please contact us at accessible@parl.gc.ca.

```

This enactment amends the Criminal Code to ensure that a person convicted of the abduction, sexual assault, and murder of the same victim, in connection with the same event or series of events, will be sentenced to imprisonment for life without eligibility for parole until they have served a sentence of between twenty-five and forty years. The exact duration will be determined by the presiding judge after considering any recommendation from the jury.

This enactment enacts the Historic Places of Canada Act, which provides for the designation of places, persons and events that are of national historic significance or national interest. It also fosters the protection and conservation of the heritage value of the designated places.

The Act, among other things, aims to:

  • Enhance the recognition and protection of cultural and natural heritage.
  • Provide guidelines for the designation of significant historical sites.
  • Encourage public engagement and understanding of Canada's heritage.

Contact Information
